title: Concurrency (road)
summary: A concurrency in a road network is an instance of one physical roadway bearing two or more different route numbers.[1] When two roadways share the same right-of-way, it is sometimes called a common section or commons.[2] Other terminology for a concurrency includes overlap,[3] coincidence,[4] duplex (two concurrent routes), triplex (three concurrent routes), multiplex (any number of concurrent routes),[5] dual routing or triple routing.[6][7]
